title: Flounce, late 17th–early 18th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Brussels-style flounce fragment with alternating motifs of volutes, flying birds, angels on either side of a fountain, flags and portrait-filled medallions. Fond: brides picotées. Modes: maille à cinq trous, portes, enchainettes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Flounce, late 17th–early 18th century.
late 17th–early 18th century. Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-142.
